documents.commentText: I am a graduate student in public health specializing in complimentary and alternative medicine, and I do not believe that Kratom or some of the chemicals which occur naturally within it should be classified as Schedule I, having no medicinal value and high potential for abuse.  This is not an overtly or acutely hazardous or poisonous plant, and it anecdotally has done much good among chronic pain patients who otherwise might be prescribed potentially life-destroying opioids or, in lower-income brackets, might simply develop alcohol addictions or turn to more dangerous street drugs.  Making Kratom Schedule I would make it much more difficult to investigate its potentially therapeutic properties -- not nearly enough research has been done at this point -- and there is currently no emergency scenario which justifies such a move.

documents.commentText: I've taken Kratom on multiple occasions for back and shoulder pain. It didn't kill me, or "get me high" but it did relieve my pain. All the research I've done on it, and the couple of occasions I've used it have proven to me that Kratom is not dangerous. And while I realize my testimony is anecdotal, I firmly believe that Kratom could be beneficial for a great many people, and needs to have more research done on it before it's blithely listed as a schedule one narcotic. I felt no narcotic-like effects while on it, only a mild mood elevation and pain relief. I strongly feel this naturally growing plant should not be banned, but I also feel more research needs to be done. I just hope the DEA has the foresight to investigate this responsibly and in a way that sheds light on both the benefits and drawbacks of this potentially helpful plant.

documents.commentText: I'm writing to you tonight from a place I never knew existed. A place of contentment and wellbeing, worry free and pain free.  I've had horrid periods since I was a young girl, too many trips to the er to even recount and countless pain pills to manage the unwavering pain. I was a young mother and wife and quickly found myself addictive to the pills that were so readily available to me.  After many years battling both my periods and the constant roller coaster of always needing more pills, I had enough. A new doctor put me on the depo shot and that was the ticket I needed to never need another pain pill. The withdrawal was pretty bad but I was determined to never go back to that lifestyle. Almost a year went by and while the physical symptoms had nearly all subsided, I was left with horrible depression and was completely drained of all the energy I'd always had. I was in a very dark place, hated myself and my life and was constantly trying every herb, vitamins, health food, you name it to regain my happiness and zest for life. I ran across a strange word I'd never heard of, kratom. After researching it for months I finally decided to give it a try, I was extremely skeptical. The bottle even sat on the counter for around 5 days before I took some of the herbal smelling capsules. I started with the lowest recommended dose, and within 45 min I got my life back. In almost 3 years of taking the plant I've never had to up my dose, or had any problems not taking it for days at a time. Opiates took my soul, and kratom went into the earth and brought it back to me. The devastating effects of banning kratom will lead so many back to the darkness the drugs and opiates took them to. In the last 3 years with the strength, energy, and happiness of kratom, I got my degree in medical massage therapy and opened my own thriving clinic and am now helping others with the power of healing. I owe it all to kratom. Please don't schedule kratom, it will be so unjust and detrimental to those who take to manage and maintain a happy and healthy lifestyle.

documents.commentText:
To Whom It May Concern:

I have used kratom on a regular basis for the past 4 years, and I cannot overstate how much it has improved the quality of my life. I have struggled with severe depression for many years, and kratom has proved immensely helpful in relieving my symptoms. Since I started enjoying the benefits of kratom, I have been much happier, healthier, and far more productive and engaged in life than I had ever been before. Kratom is not a substance that helps one escape from life, but rather it is one that helps one tackle life's challenges with optimism, motivation, and a clear, focused mind. Like many kratom users, I am an educated, hard-working, and law-abiding individual who is involved in my community. I am a college graduate and a returned Peace Corp volunteer, I am gainfully employed, and I am an aspiring entrepreneur. I highly value maintaining good health and practicing personal responsibility, and I am planning for my future. Kratom has helped me manage the emotional issues that had previously held me back, and it has thereby helped me to become a better person. I am merely one of countless individuals who have found relief in this special plant. It would cause me significant personal hardship if I no longer had access to it, as I have not had the same level of success with any other method of managing my symptoms, including prescription medication. I firmly believe that scheduling kratom would be a terrible mistake, which would cause far more harm than good. People all over the country have found relief in kratom from numerous physical and mental ailments and have used it to overcome the impediments imposed by their symptoms. I am proud to count myself among them. On behalf of myself, who has a considerable personal stake in the uninterrupted availability of this plant, and on behalf of all kratom users, many of whom would suffer more greatly without kratom than I would, I implore you and your colleagues to consider the profoundly negative impact that scheduling kratom will have on many thousands of American citizens. If you get to know the kratom community, you will find that it overwhelmingly consists of perfectly decent, industrious, bright, health-conscious, and responsible citizens, whose only crime is a desire to mitigate their chronic health problems. Having used kratom daily for years, I can personally attest to the fact that it does not cause health or behavioral problems. Quite the contrary. Kratom is by no means a danger to individuals or the community. The only danger lies in restricting access to something as beneficial as kratom, and for which there is simply no substitute. I thank you very much for your consideration.

In 2013 I told my doctor about kratom, he was very happy with my progress and I've decided to wean myself off antidepressants. My life received a total makeover. Since kratom saved me from horrible anexiety, I was able to function once again. I stopped seeing my doctor, as I've told him I was doing very well with my daily kratom supplement.. documents.commentText:
Hi,

I'd like to comment about kratom. 

I live a very holistic lifestyle, I make my own face washes, cleaners, eat healthy organic & mostly local food, love my herbal teas and natural remedies and I'm both saddened and angered by the loss of freedom of what I'm legally allowed to put into my own body. 

I understand wanting to protect people but given that there is hardly any research on this plant, no deaths from kratom alone (all mixed with pharmaceuticals), nothing alarming about the plant family kratom is a part (love my coffee!), I just don't understand what the ban could possibly be about other than the it hurting the pharmaceutical industry which is far more toxic than kratom. So toxic that I avoid it at all costs which is how most kratom users feel as well. 

I've been drinking kratom for several years and drinking coffee for far longer and not only am I healthier than most people I know, I'm also far more productive in society. Ideally I'd like for these loss of choice laws to cease to exist but at the very least, if you're going to implement them have several years of research to back of your decision. Right now there is next to nothing to warrant such a decision and I strongly urge you to keep kratom legal until proven other wise.

The wide spread outcry from the kratom community shows just how much of a positive impact it has had on numerous lives and it would just be mean and and unjust to ban kratom without proving the bad outweighs the good.  

Sincerely,

~Whitney

documents.commentText:
I am a 33 year old, female, stay at home mom, who suffers from chronic back pain. In the past i have used Kratom (about 6 years ago) for anxiety. It got me through a tough time and I no longer needed it.
Now, I suffer from many different back problems, due to an old injury. I have been through multiple physical therapy- pain management, injections, 5 different medications, chiropractor/acupuncture, massage, creams, and the list goes on. I have found NOTHING that compares to the relief I achieve from Kratom. 
I remembered Kratom, and started taking it again- regularly 2 years ago. It has changed my life. I am able to live my life again, take care of my home and family, run errands, and chase after my toddler and be the best mom i can be. Before I started taking Kratom again, my family life was taking a turn for the worst. I rarely slept without meds and they rarely helped anyway. I couldn't get out of my bed in the morning. I had to take MORE prescription meds, and still couldnt really do anything. The side effects I had from everything I took were terrible. So terrible, I was angry, depressed, gained weight, anxiety- my fiance and I fought daily because he didn't know how to help, and I felt I was a burdon. 
I was depressed about everything, especially not being able to play with my baby. THAT was the hardest. Sometimes I had to call my fiance home from work because I was in so much pain I couldn't lift my baby, let alone stand any longer. I couldn't cook healthy meals, take care of the home, nothing. It was very sad, and i knew everyone was better off without me.
 Now, I have a wonderful life again. My family is happy, I am happy, and we were able to move into a new house. WE plan to be married in spring, and we have achieved so much together. 
When i heard Kratom would be banned- we were all upset- I was devestated. Like hearing someone died. My heart breaks to think about going back to the place I/my family was in. We are very active, always busy, going places and enjoying our lives... I can't imagine the impact I would have on my family if I was in such pain again. It would be a sad thing for sure. I'm writing this with tears in my eyes and I can only pray that Kratom will not be removed from my life. Not just for me, but for all the other people out there that suffer too.

documents.commentText:
Hello Professionals at DEA;
  
      You have likely received many comments already.   This may be similar to most, but has so much meaning for me.   

      For several years I have been nearly incapacitated by symptoms similar to IBS, chronic fatigue, fibromyalgia.   Some days are good, most days are symptomatic and some I was unable to revive out of bed from such discomfort and weakness.    For years I battled without diagnosis that troubled my doctors.    

      I then discovered Kratom from online blogs of people suffering similarly.   The first week I tried Kratom, I regained hope that I could once again restart my career.   Subsequently I have found that a diagnoses might be pending, but one that there is little that can be done due to the stage I am in (Adrenal failure).    

      Without the use of Kratom, I would have zero chance of recovery as the doctors will prescribe medications to combat my symptoms, but they will accelerate the deterioration.   Currently on Kratom I can return to normal activity including work and martial arts exercise and even training my three kids in their sports.    Without Kratom, they will lose their father again as they did for two year prior to finding Kratom.   

     I realize that you have our best interest in mind.   I realize there are substances prone to abuse and that can cost tremendously in tax payer money.   Consider my story and the low incidence attributed to Kratom.   For Kratom only users like me, there appears to be no danger, and certainly less than even prescription meds.   

I thank you already for having given me a few extra months and the opportunity to share my story with you.

documents.commentText:
I would like, at this time, to voice my great distress at the potential scheduling of several of the key components of the Mitragyna speciosa as Schedule 1 substances for two very key reasons. First and foremost, there is not, so far as any science that I am aware of, any legitimate risk in the consumption of these substances. Even anecdotally, evidence is scant, at best, and tends to only point out the obvious, which is that substances with we consume blithely on a daily basis (something like caffeine comes to mind), are capable of far more deleterious effects (as anyone who has had too many cups of coffee too fast surely knows) and offer a far greater chance of addiction (any regular coffee drinker can readily attest to the mid-afternoon withdrawal headaches that come along inevitably when one's morning cup or cups of joe get skipped for one reason or another). If withdrawals can accompany kratom, they are so minimal as to be all but unnoticeable in my personal experience. The scheduling of kratom would therefore merely create an otherwise unnecessary need for enforcement to prevent the use of an unusually benign substance that's been consumed with no real negative outcomes by humans for thousands of years.  

Secondly, there are the beneficial aspects of kratom. While I can only tend to describe them in fairly abstract terms as the effects are very mild, consuming kratom has left me, overall, which a much improved over all quality of life that Ive experienced the past two years as a consumer. MY overall mood is greatly enhanced, with both my general stress as well as my anxiety levels greatly diminished. In general, I feel an ease-of-mind I hadnt previously felt, which has been very beneficial in both my person an my professional relationships. Ive also found that I consume far less alcohol than I had been previously before discovering kratom, and while I was never anywhere close to what one would call a problem drinker, Im sure my overall health has still been improved given how much Ive cut back over the last several years.

In short, I would like to see kratom continue to be treated for what it is: a beneficial, comparatively risk-free herb. I think both consumers and the government would find that arrangement most mutually beneficial.

documents.commentText: I have been supplementing Kratom, which is effective because of mitragynine and 7-hydroxymitragynine, to my diet for the past 3 years. Before then, I had suffered from depression and crippling anxiety which caused me to frequently pass out. I refused to take prescription antidepressants for fear of fully losing myself in a blurr of dull, dead sensation to life. I watch several family members take prescription antidepressants and lose the ability to have normal human emotions. They quit taking them and this is not what I wanted for myself either. I was on the search for something to awaken my brain's serotonin receptors, not just to glaze over the root of the problem. I found Kratom through another family member who has studied holistic and medicinal herbs her whole life. Once I began supplementing Kratom, bought from a reputable herbal supplier, my whole world opened up. I have not suffered from depression or anxiety ever since. I take two teaspoons in the morning and am great for the rest of the day. Not only has it allowed me escape the cycle of depression, it has drastically improved the pain and mood swings I have to go through every month during womanly cycles. The pain is almost nonexistent, and I no longer find myself curled up in a ball on the floor. Kratom helps me get through long tough work days, when before I'd want to give up, cry, quit. Kratom gives me an enthusiastic "go getter" attitude and I've accomplished goals I set out a long time ago. I have saved and saved and outright bought the land I've dreamed of owning to turn into a utopia for my family. Kratom has done nothing but improve the quality of my life. Before I was doomed to visit therapists who do not help, and constantly referred me to other doctors. I knew I could win this battle by myself, and Kratom has helped me do just that. The FDA does not own my body. This is my body. I have little faith that the FDA is unbiased and is pressured by Big Pharma. The FDA has approved hundreds of medications that have proved to be destructive to human health and incredibly addictive. I constantly see ads for settlements being made for medication after medication that have hurt or killed people. Thousands of prescription addicts have turned to the black market once they no longer can get prescriptions filled. It's such a destructive cycle people have been forced into. We all know the disease, cancer rate, and drug addiction in America is worse than ever. People are in dire need of transparency to choose the right food and medicine for themselves. I feel Americans are paying for having their lives quietly controlled into having very few choices when it concerns their own health. My body is not the property of the FDA and big pharma. Please allow people to start taking a stand for their own lives. Kratom has helped thousands of people for years without adverse effects. Kratom is not for everyone, but it is for thousands. Please leave us this choice. Please look at all the support Kratom users have put forth to stop the scheduling of Kratom in the same category as heroin and LSD. It DOES have medicinal value. Look at all the lives it has influenced that were able to stop the first emergency scheduling. This is a huge feat that so many people took to heart and succeeded. Please don't take it away from us. The US is changing before our eyes, please be a part of a positive change. Please protect Kratom and its' advocates. If Kratom becomes illegal, a rug would be pulled out from thousands of people's feet, leaving them in a dangerous rut. Keep Kratom legal; if Kratom is kept legal, it will be safe from the hands of those who would use it to illegally take advantage of the people who need help the most. We need to support the productivity Kratom has boosted within people who have been held down for so long.

documents.commentText:
I have bipolar disorder, and for over 25 years I suffered from episodes of severe depression, sometimes to the point of being suicidal. The medications prescribed by my psychiatrist did not always help. After researching natural alternatives to supplement my prescriptions, I discovered Mitragyna speciosa (kratom). I found that ingesting kratom lessens the severity of my depressive episodes and can sometimes even prevent the episodes if taken in their early stages.

I take kratom, on average, once or twice a month, for two or three days in a row. My dosage ranges from five to eight grams (once a day) and has produced no side effects, other than slight itchiness. I have experienced no "high" or psychotic effects. I have on occasion taken kratom for longer periods with no problem stopping after that time and no feelings of withdrawal.

If kratom were no longer available, I would either have to again endure severe depressive episodes and risk self-harm and possibly suicidal ideation, or rely on anti-depressants in higher doses and with numerous undesirable side effects (sometimes as bad as the depression itself). Please allow kratom to remain available to the public!

documents.commentText:
Let us look at another plant which was placed "temporarily" in category 1 back in 1970; cannabis.

1970: Pres Nixon appointed 'The National Commission on Marijuana' to determine the danger of cannabis.
1972: The Commission recommends decriminalizing cannabis. They were ignored.
1988: DEA Administrative Law Judge Francis Young recommends removal of cannabis from category 1.
Young said it would be 'unreasonable, arbitrary and capricious (odd) for the DEA to stand between suffering Americans and
the medical benefits of cannabis'. He too was ignored.
2015: Congress declares that the DEA would announce whether cannabis would finally be removed from category 1.
2016: DEA affirms that cannabis has no medical value, a blatant lie, which polarizes the country, with the majority of Americans
FAVORING FULL LEGALIZATION of cannabis.

During an 'OPIOID EPIDEMIC', one of the few positive trends we see is that states with medical cannabis available
have 25% FEWER opioid deaths than states that don't. 
(source: John Hopkins Univ/ The Rand Corp)

In these modern times, with terrorists and rouge states with nuclear capabilities who actually pose a direct threat to our country,
cyber crimes, ponzi schemes and fraud reaching the BILLION dollar mark before it is finally discovered, I can not help but ask:

Is THIS, plants that kill no one, REALLY what we should be worrying about?

documents.commentText:
RE: Docket No. DEA-442W:
My name is Greg Toth & I'm a 39 year old male and I'd like to voice my concern & opposition regarding the DEA's misinformed decision to make Kratom (Mitragyna Speciosa) a Schedule I drug (this is the same class as heroin, crack, cocaine, LSD, etc!!). Most importantly, please understand that kratom is an herbal remedy and not a drug. It's on par with Coffee, Kava Kava, Valerian Root & countless other herbal supplements that help combat anxiety, fatigue, insomnia with the difference being that Kratom can single-handedly soothe all 3 of those common factors in our daily lives. I have been using Kratom for over 4 years to help with migraines, arthritis, fatigue, to assist in the reduction of anxiety, to aid in dulling life's minor aches & pains as well as promoting a subtle sense of well-being. Within those 4 years, I was also able to lower my alcohol intake to less than (the doctor-recommended) 1 glass of red wine a day thanks to kratom (kratom does not make one drunk or high nor is it toxic to the liver unlike the 'legal' alcohol). I was also able to stop using NSAIDS (Tylenol, Ibuprofen, etc) as often for migraines as these have been proven to cause liver issues and even liver failure (unlike kratom!!). Many responsible adults rely on kratom as a mild life-enhancing herb no different from those who rely on their Coffee, Chamomile or any other herb that has been used for thousands of years without negative impact upon society. Kratom has increased my productivity which in turn has helped me become more of a productive member of society!  I run two (going on three) successful businesses of which one of them sells kratom (online). Several individuals rely on my kratom store for their economic well-being and as the business becomes more successful, I have been employing more people that make their living from this industry. Banning kratom will not only have adverse health effects on society but it will also put hundreds of thousands of people out of a job. My own income will be negatively impacted by this ban at a time when my fianc (soon-to-be-wife) and I are planning to form a family. Kratom should remain legal and available for responsible adults like myself and my fianc who live more productive lives thanks to this mild herb that has been used safely for thousands of years.  It is widely understood by the community & an ever-growing array of media outlets that kratom has received undue scrutiny by those that see kratom as a means to lose revenue or worse. This ban is absolutely not in the best interest of the public, there are over 100,000 signatures on the white house petition in less than 10 days. The people do not support this outdated and quite frankly draconian approach to an herb that has been in our society (the U.S.) for at least 10 years w/out much incident. We are relying on our lawmakers to listen and speak up for the people and we remain hopeful that you will consider a reasonable outcome to the kratom situation such as an 18+ age restriction (which we completely support). Please, help restore the faith of the people in our lawmakers and do the right thing by us. The ban of this benign plant (especially while alcohol, tobacco, etc are available) would be bad news for all responsible adults and for purveyors of personal choice, freedom & liberty...the very fabric from which this land was sewn!

A few more facts for you to consider when making your informed decision:

?	The FDLE Report of Kratom: A review of available law enforcement and laboratory sources in Florida demonstrates that Kratom does not currently constitute a significant risk to the safety and welfare of Florida residents. According to the Florida Department of Health (DOH), no pervasive health issues have been attributed to the ingestion of Kratom products in Florida.
?	According to the CDC, cigarette smoking causes 440,000 deaths in the United States every year; about one of every five deaths in this country are caused by cigarettes!  
?	Alcohol causes more than 1.2 million emergency room visits and 2.7 million physician office visits due to excessive drinking each year!
?	Pharmaceutical drugs are one of the leading causes of death in this country, killing one American every 19 minutes! 
?	Prescription opiate pain killers account for more than 475,000 emergency room visits annually.
?	Over the counter pain relievers such as Tylenol send over 56,000 people to the emergency room each year with liver related complications.
?	The Mayo Clinic has reported a 28% increase in overall mortality in people who drink 4 cups of coffee per day.
Thank you for your time, consideration and service to the people of the U.S. who rely on your wisdom.

Sincerely,

Gregory Toth
(Multiple Business Owner, Job Creator, Tax Payer, Kratom Advocate, Fianc, Son & Soon To Be Father...)

documents.commentText: I am a single mom of 2. My son is disabled and things can get stressful as well as being alot hard work. I tried to quit subocone but my doctor said I "was not ready". I had never had an addiction issue only physical dependancy so the doctor not helping me quit the drug regardless of my history and ongoing physical issues from it was terrible. I was getting sicker and sicker from the subocone aND I had to take it on myself. SUbozone is almost 100x stronger than morphine. I don't know if you can but imagine withdrawling off a drug this strong but it was hands down the most difficult thing I have ever done. Afterm 3 days and the situation getting worse I could see how my family as a whole was suffering from my preoccupation with the withdrawl. I have always tried natural cures and they generally always worked. So I read about kratom, and decided to try it. My kids were so happy to have me back and if it wasn't for kraton I would probably be dead from a terrible physician and drug I was put on. Please don't ban kratom, there's millions of people in he same situation,  and if they have an alternative to deal with the intense physical and emotional pain withdrawal causes they can be more productive citizens and therefore make the world a better place. I believe in 12 step programs, but I tell everyone about my experience,  how bad the subocone and the doctors prescribing it are as well as the miraculous curing effect kratom had on me and undoubtedly saved me and my famity from more difficult times and disapointment. furthermore I currently take small amounts of kraton for chronic back pain and knee pain and I have not needed or wanted any type of painkiller since finding the benefits of kratom. Banning kratom is an injustice to people becausw ot is a very effective painkiller as well as an alternative to more physically addictive substances while not altering your mental state at all. Let's work together and actually make the world a better place for our children and their future and allow all the possibilities for healthy recoveries and pain management .

documents.commentText:
I was diagnosed with an auto immune disease 8 years ago.  The damage one to my body and the subsequent pain I experienced at times was all consuming. With a full time job and small children at home I found life intolerable. If I took the opiates to curb the pain I would wake up the following day groggy and in worst pain.  I became depressed and knew I would not be able to work much longer.
After much research I discovered Kratom.  I researched as much as I could on it and finally decided to try it.  The relief I got was immediate.  I experienced zero side effects.  I woke the next day able to get up and go to work.  I have never experienced anything resembling hallucinations or any thing close to a dangerous side affect.  I am able to care for my children and work due to a non opiate option for pain.  I once questioned if continuing life with this level of constant pain was worth it.  I felt useless to my family when after working I crawled into bed and could barely move.  
I have days in which I do not have to take it at all and I don't experience any withdrawal symptoms and I have never had to increase the amount I take.  When taking opiates I had been up to 1500 mg and still felt little relief.  I found something that would help me and was natural not created in a lab.  I beg the DEA to please think of the people who do not want to be addicted to opiates and want nothing more then to be productive members of society and not on disability due to pain or the meds we would have to take.  Please do not take away from us a means to avoid addiction and live our lives peacefully.   I had heard that it could help with addiction and was able to help a friend through Kratom quit opiates after 10 years.  She can now function and work full time.  All from a plant that has been used for thousands of years.  I ask the government to not take away our ability to make the decision that we feel is best for us or even limit it.  I am so afraid of the prospect of going back to life before I discovered something that would help my pain.  Please reconsider.

documents.commentText:
Dear fellow Americans at the DEA,

I ask that you please do not schedule Kratom. Kratom has benefited my life in many ways. Since the age of 26 I have had debilitating chronic pain caused by degenerative disks. It has made my young life very difficult and even led to serious depression. When the doctor I was going to first prescribed me opiates they helped at first but between tolerance issues, health and life dangers and the massive potential for addiction I have had to reject this form of treatment. I do not want to take opiates for pain relief. Most people in chronic pain including myself have had tremendous problems even getting the care we deserve and pay for. The regulations on opiate medications have caused doctors to leave people in debilitating pain and without hope for their futures. This was my experience as well, it was very difficult to even convince the numerous doctors I have seen to help at all. After feeling completely neglected by the medical industry  research online led to kratom. My first experience with the natural and safe supplement proved to help me tremendously. In many ways I felt I had my life back. In september when the prospect of scheduling kratom came up myself and thousands of people in this country were devastated. I never thought the government or DEA would have the slightest interest in kratom. It is safe and helps people everyday. I know it is safe because I have taken the supplement for 2 years on and off. The science that I read from the DEA was not congruent with reports from users of kratom and in my own opinion/ Experience it did not represent the kratom plant and its effects. I ask that you please understand the uses of kratom and the fact that many thousands will be left in debilitating pain by this decision. We have tried to give testimonials, we have tried to provide the accurate science, we have made every effort to stop this ban because it is life with pain and misery or life that allows for kratom to be used as a supplement, therefore a pain free existence. In my own user experience I have become a very productive member of our society. Having my body back is the biggest gift I have ever received and I could not explain the fear I have of being left to rot by the DEA and their desicion. Please do not take this safe natural supplement from the people of this country in life destroying pain. Kratom is a plant and a safe supplement that is being unjustifiably attacked. Every person in this great country should have the birth right to refuse opiate medication and have the basic human right to use nature as a supplement. While I believe 100% that the DEA is not only necessary but helps to keep many people safe from street drugs I believe this would be a massive disservice to myself, the pain community, people without health insurance, and those that refuse opiate medication. Please hear our cries for justice and help us to continue to have the right to supplements. Thank you for your efforts I pray that I will not be left to suffer by the systems like the DEA that I trust and believe in.

documents.commentText:
I own a digital marketing agency and have been taking Kratom for about 5 years. I like to take it with coffee as it kind of gives me an extra little perk. Kratom has done wonderful things for me throughout my days, such as removed social anxiety, allow me to focus on otherwise boring or repetitive tasks, helps me in crowds of people, and lowers my stress/blood pressure.

I have experienced very minor withdrawal symptoms when stopping kratom for a few days here or there, mostly a bit of restless leg, slight chills and difficulty concentrating. All of these are very mild and from what I've been told and seen, are nowhere near the severity of a detox of say alcohol or heroin. You can actually die from detoxing off of alcohol, and the heroin detox apparently makes you want to die it is so bad.

In the past, I have tried other substances and have also been prescribed pharmaceuticals for various things(minor surgeries, dental work, etc), and have actually been 'high' from these substances, where I wouldn't be able to work or operate a car or any other machinery. My balance and judgement were impaired, and it was best to sit on a couch watching TV or sleeping it off.

Kratom has never impaired me anywhere near this level. In fact, I doubt it has ever impaired me at all. My digital marketing agency has grown to be a 6 figure annual small business with many clients who trust me to manage their marketing. I sometimes work 16 hour days. The company continues to grow and I have never thought about slacking off because I want to go get high on Kratom.. Never has that even crossed my mind, as having been a consumer of this herb, I know that it would be impossible to get such a high. 

Is alcohol a schedule 1 with an imminent public health crisis? No. Yet it is incredibly more powerful, addictive, dangerous, and impairing.

Is coffee a schedule 1 with an imminent health crisis? No. And yet, the effects of coffee are similar to the effects of Kratom, with similar withdrawals.

By moving this to a Schedule 1, it would affect me in many ways. First, I wwill likely be a criminal because it is something that has helped my life, and I would need to attempt to secure it on a newly created 'Black market'. I would have to buy it fro criminals who don't care about me or the purity of this naturally grown, God given plant.

Our friends to the north in Canada can buy this plant legally, just about anywhere. What kind of border security would we need to stop this from coming in through the north, just like so many substances make their way through our ports and southern borders.

As a tax paying citizen, I urge you to not expand the drug war, but rather shrink it. It costs too much money and it improisons too many harmless, peaceful people. It is financially contributing to the shrinking of the middle class and making us poorer.

Let's continue the discussion and look toward at the very most, regulating the market, not just blindly banning something that is no more dangerous than multivitamins, health supplements, and coffee.

Thanks for the withdrawal of the original letter, and I look forward to a sensible conclusion to this issue.

documents.commentText:
I am a registered nurse who after 23 years of taking care of people, my body has begun to have aches and pains during my 12 hour shifts. About 10 years ago, I was given hydrocodone and was almost instantly addicted. I thankfully found Kratom and beat that. I now use it on occasion to help, after my shifts, to sleep better and not feel like I was hit by a truck when I wake up!

I have had no side effects like I did on opioids. I do not get "high", and I am able to take small doses when needed, and none when I don't.

Making this a schedule I will make it hard for anyone to study and formulate a standard strain to help with pain, anxiety, sleep and relaxation. This could potentially reduce opioid abuse as well as abuse of benzodiazepines.

As with anything, including legal alcohol, anyone can become addicted. But Kratom has a substantially lower risk of abuse and if you feel it needs to be regulated, fine. But PLEASE dont schedule I this plant and make many people turn to the destructive alternatives.

documents.commentText:
Kratom is a both a useful herb to the general public as well as a potential unearthed gem to the world of medicine.  It is a plant rich in unique phytochemicals which show promise in their raw and purified forms as medical treatments and health supplements for a variety of reasons.  The alkaloid profile of kratom is as follows: 

?  Ajmalicine (Raubasine): Cerebrocirculant, antiaggregant, anti-adrenergic (at alpha-1), sedative, anticonvulsant, smooth muscle relaxer 
? Corynantheidine: Opioid antagonist 
? Corynoxeine: Calcium channel blocker
? Corynoxine A and B: Dopamine mediating anti-locomotives  
? (-)-Epicatechin: Antioxidant, antiaggregant, antibacterial, antidiabetic, antihepatitic, anti-inflammatory, anti-leukemic, antimutagenic, antiperoxidant, antiviral, cancer preventative, alpha-amylase inhibitor  
? 9-Hydroxycorynantheidine: Partial opioid agonist
? 7-Hydroxymitragynine: Analgesic, antitussive, antidiarrheal; primary psychoactive in kratom
? Isomitraphylline: Immunostimulant, anti-leukemic
? Isopteropodine: Immunostimulant
? Mitragynine: Analgesic, antitussive, antidiarrheal, adrenergic, antimalarial, possible (5-HT2A) antagonist (anti-psychotic)
? Mitraphylline: Vasodilator, antihypertensive, muscle relaxer, diuretic, anti-amnesic, possible immunostimulant
? Paynantheine: Smooth muscle relaxer
? Rhynchophylline: Vasodilator, antihypertensive, calcium channel blocker, antiaggregant, anti-inflammatory, antipyretic, anti-arrhythmic, antithelmintic
? Speciociliatine: Weak opioid agonist
? Speciogynine: Smooth muscle relaxer
? Speciophylline: Anti-leukemic
? Tetrahydroalstonine: Hypoglycemic, adrenergic (alpha-2 adrenergic antagonist)


As you can see, the plant contains a number of beneficial constituents which can all be researched using the available literature such as that on www.scholar.google.com and public scientific databases  To ban such a plant, and the compounds it contains, would massively impede in scientific research into both heart and circulatory supportive supplements and pain relieving medicines.  The plant should be left legal in its unaltered form, either as a cut and sifted leaf, or a powder.

documents.commentText:
Kratom does not belong in our broken drug scheduling system!  Many people struggling with opioid addiction have turned to kratom as a safer alternative, and all promising scientific studies on its role in opioid treatment would be immediately shut down by a Schedule I designation.  Kratom is a medicinal plant and natural substance used for millennia in Southeast Asia and currently used by millions in the U.S that is being actively studied in the U.S. for therapeutic uses.

Schedule I is reserved for substances that have a high potential for abuse, no currently accepted medical use in treatment in the United States and no accepted safety for use of the drug or other substance under medical supervision, criteria that differ from scientific literature exploring kratom and its constituents.

This designation would effectively halt scientific investigation into kratoms medicinal benefits, while making it impossible to enact sensible legal regulations, such as quality control measures,product labeling requirements, as well as marketing, branding and retail display restrictions, which are long proven to reduce substance misuse and youth access.

Decisions about how drugs are classified and regulated should be guided by science -- not by law enforcement. Scheduling decisions should be led by federal health agencies, with input from independent scientists and experts.

Additionally, this designation would lead to more people who struggle with addiction to be criminalized and additional unnecessary mass incarcerations!  There is widespread moral, political and scientific consensus that drug use and addiction are best treated as health issues rather than as criminal,theres should be no good reason to criminalize people simply for using kratom especially considering how much we already know aboutprohibitions disproportionate impact on people of color and other marginalized communities.

documents.commentText:
Below are a few posts from Reddit, commenting on use of Full Spectrum Tincture, a common extract of Kratom that's readily available online. They offer proof that extract and tinctures have the same side effects of most hard drugs.

All were posted over two years ago.

#1
FST are as close to heroin as you can get. They feel dirty, the high is crazy euphoric, the worst itches I've ever experienced and makes you nod off about the same. Even after two days, you need about double your original dose just to feel "normal" and the high is almost nonexistent, similar to heroin. 
The withdrawals are terrible. Flu like, sore throat, always tired, muscle aches, anxiety. Ugh, every year or so I forget about all of this and buy about 60-70 dollars of FST and subsequently have the worst time ever. STAY AWAY!
If you're looking to get high off Kratom, you're doing it for the wrong reasons. With that said, I'd actually suggest that you go cop off the streets or get something from your doctor since FST is so dangerous and such a slippery slope. Post tincture withdrawals are way worse than any low level opiate (Vicodin, Percocet) I've had a habit it from. While it may not be as bad as a heroin habit, it's close and not worth it at all!

#2
Disclaimer: I accept full responsibility for any stupidity I have gotten myself into.
I was able to have a fairly healthy relationship with Bali powder for a long time (over 2 years). My relationship with FST was immediately bad. The tolerance shot up - even when I did my damndest to use the stuff carefully, that tolerance shot up. Soon was using a bottle a day and would get classic opiod style withdrawals if I didn't get some at least every 4 hours. This included dosing in the middle of the night. Pathetic.
I decided to kick cold turkey this past Friday. The first 3 days were equal to any hell I have experienced with pharmaceutical opiate withdrawals. Uncontrollable RLS in my legs and arms, deep bone aches, chills, crushing depression, insomnia, and of course the shits. 
On day 6 things got better but I still have lingering body aches, some chills, diarrhea, depression and most of all - terrible insomnia. I have never struggled with insomnia in the past and now my heart goes out to those who have. It's a bitch and a half. Nothing touches it - Klonopin, weed, Lyrica... 
Anyhow, again I am just saying this in the spirit of harm reduction. I think Kratom can be responsibly used by many people. I just don't think the tinctures have much to offer and are way too risky. 

#3 - The "O" in other is an obvious reference to opiates
I have been using Kratom for sometime as well... I dont know much.. but SS's FST is the best in the land. I actually prefer it to "O"ther things.

documents.commentText:
I am very concerned about the potential ban of kratom. I know many people who have used it to overcome hard opiate addiction, and I am afraid for what might happen to those individuals if they were no longer able to access this helpful plant. Opiate addiction relapse happens at very high rates without replacement therapy, and kratom, for some, can be as effective as much more potent alternatives like suboxone and methadone. For many, the latter options are not options at all. Such individuals would sooner just go back to heroin or whatever hard opiate of choice. It is my belief that some people are just wired to be opiate addicts, and it seems as though kratom provides a much milder alternative than any pharmaceutical or street narcotics available. 

Many people who have used kratom for extended periods of time report minimal withdraw symptoms, similar to those from caffeine. It seems illogical to ban kratom while not banning similar drugs like coffee. I mean, where are we heading with this policy, I thought our country collectively doesn't believe in draconian rules such as those we would expect to find under sharia law. The way I see it, if you're going to ban kratom, might as well ban alcohol, tobacco, coffee, and while you're at it, let's require women to cover their faces in public and always be accompanied by a male relative when outside of the home. 

Furthermore, this all seems very suspicious, given pharmaceutical companies are beginning to examine the benefits of the active ingredients of kratom. Has their potential intent to monopolize these chemicals been fully analyzed? 

As I understand, there have been a total of 5 deaths linked to kratom, and in at least 4 of these cases it was shown the individual used other drugs such as heroin in combination with kratom. And, i'm sure I'm telling you something you already know when I say that junkies are notorious liars. 

Also, it has been reported that many gas station varieties have been laced with other research chemical opioids. If anything is to be done, we should be randomly purchasing kratom from suppliers, testing it for other chemicals added, and shutting down or at least penalizing those suppliers that provide contaminated product.

documents.commentText:
I personally know a lot of people who have gotten clean from other, more intense, ACTUAL drugs like heroin, with the help of kratom. I am not one of these people- I did heroin, but I quit cold turkey, as I decided I didn't want to live the dysfunctional, self-destructive life of an addict. I use Kratom in place of more intense pharmaceuticals-- whereas I used to do oxycontin in insane amounts (like, 6 oxy 80's a day), now I just have a little Kratom. This isn't because it's a comparable high- Kratom can't hold a candlle to real opioids. In fact, most of the people I've given some to, who do heroin, don't like it, and would rather just spend the money on heroin. People who take Kratom are dedicated to quitting the more addictive drug that started them on opioids in the first place- unlike most people who take methadone (maybe not suboxone- I haven't met anyone who's had it, because of its low abuse potential). Kratom, for me, provides a slight 'relaxed' feeling, while giving me energy, and I use it in a manner similar to coffee.

The active alkaloids in Kratom do not cause respiratory depression, and actually preferentially bind to delta, as opposed to mu, or morphine, receptors. The small amount of the active alkaloids in Kratom that actually hit mu (morphine, again, for the laymen) receptors are just enough to help people with chronic pain relieve their pain, help an ex-junkie stay off of drugs, or help just about anyone with a really bad cough, though Kratom, in my experience, doesn't really provide much cough suppression.

BAN KRATOM AND PEOPLE WILL GO BACK TO THE DRUGS THAT THEY STARTED ON, AND MANY WILL OVERDOSE AND DIE

documents.commentText: I am a 28 year old female with chronic back pain and, worst of all,  sciatica.  I don't know if you have ever felt a sciatica flare up but it is almost unbearable. 6 years ago I was on heavy doses of hydrocodone and Klonopin to manage the pain and I quickly became addicted to my medicine. And after a while it stopped working and I needed to take more and more to have any kind of pain relief. When I had to stop taking my medicine to withdrawal was absolute hell. My doctors did not warn me about the withdrawal. They kept upping my dose of pain medicine never warned me how hard it would be to not take it. I soon moved to Oregon and was making very little money so I didn't have a doctor I could afford when my sciatica came back. I would be in extreme pain for 2 weeks and then it would go away for a week and come back a week later and last for weeks on end. I clean houses at the time so it was extremely inconvenient to be in that kind of pain all the time. And that's when I found kratom. I could take just a couple of grams and my pain would be gone. I can't begin to describe the relief of being pain free after spending weeks in that kind of pain. And the best part of all is when I didn't take it I didn't have any negative side effects. It wasn't like with the pain medicine where I had to take it all the time to keep myself from having withdrawals. And I also didn't need to spend hundreds of dollars at a doctor's office for them to give me something that wouldn't help and to go back every month and continue to not receive the help I needed. I have been taking Kratom for 5 years now. documents.commentText: To the esteemed constituents of the Drug Enforcement Administration,  To begin ,I will relate my own experience with the plant known here in the US as Kratom. I first tried Kratom having no knowledge whatsoever about the effects or traditional usage of the plant. I found it to be mildly stimulating and relaxing at the same time,also giving some relief to a persistent lower back pain I have suffered from for years. In my opinion this substance certainly does have a potential for addiction  but probably less than many other substances that are legal such as coffee, tobacco and alcohol. Our country is currently in the grip of an opioid epidemic , both pharmaceutical (oxcycontin,etc,) and contraband ( Heroin and the synthetic parallel substances}. I personally have lost a friend to this scourge.Many are struggling to escape from this addiction and kratom is providing people with an opportunity to do so without resorting to the much stronger and more dangerous pharmaceutical opioids .There is minimal danger from the use of kratom and to deny people who are in need of this alternative ,on the grounds of protecting the people , strikes me as cruel and inconsiderate in the extreme.To deny a safe alternative to opioids ,on the contrary , is a sentence of death to many . Mark my words , death from overdose will spike dramatically, if you reschedule  this wonderful beneficial plant. Just as for many years so many lives have been damaged or destroyed by the wrongful scheduling of cannabis, a wonderful ,God given medicine as well , in the name of protecting the people! I believe passionately that it is time you learned from your mistakes . Stop  denying to the populace the simple beneficial plant medicines that have been in use for millennia!  From all appearances it would seem that lobbying on the part of giant Pharma and chemical concerns has warped the judgement of those authorities who have the power to alleviate the suffering of humankind. I beseech you ,in the name of all goodness, to be honest, and take careful consideration of your  acts. You are directly responsible for the well being of millions ,do the right thing!  Sincerely,  Tracy Hughes

documents.commentText:
My name is Teresa Fitts and I reside in Pontotoc, Mississippi.  I am a 51 yr old nurse practitioner and have done so for 15 years.  I am the DEA to please not schedule or ban Kratom supplement.  I am a current user of this beneficial supplement  and have used the product for approximately 4 years. I like other people in my age group suffer from severe degenerative joint disease as well as chronic severe spinal disc disease that leaves me with significant daily pain.  Additionally, I have peripheral neuropathy in my lower legs and feet.  I have worked in the emergency room for most of my 15 years as a nurse practitioner.  I have never taken opium based products on a daily basis because of the devastating effects I have personally observed in the chronic opiate user for chronic pain.  The effects of opium used on a daily basis is not effective and has caused millions of Americans to become addicts.  I see the typical behaviors addicts use to manipulate everyone in their life that eventually destroys any kind of functional life for these people and have witnessed many drug overdoses and deaths in this population of people who never intended to be a drug addict.  This unfortunate population become manipulators and will do anything to continue to use opiates.  At this point, these people are no longer taking opiates for pain relief but for a sense of " feeling good" all the way to death from overdose.  The vast majority of this population would never have become addicts if they had a supplement or product that actually works for pain relief and not dependence.  I do not want to become part of this unfortunate population!  Kratom has been a SAFE product for me to treat my chronic pain.  Without Kratom, I fully believe that I would no longer be a functioning, productive citizen any longer and will probably become completely disabled.  I do not know how this product works.  I urge the DEA to invest their efforts in learning how this supplement decreases and in my case almost relieves it completely.  Kratom does not cause any alteration or decrease in my mental capacity to be a highly functioning professional in a fast paced environment.  I have gone weeks at a time between purchasing the product and have never had any withdrawal effects.  I only experience the excursating pain and neuropathy in my back, legs and feet.  If you have ever tried this botanical supplement, you would understand that it impossible to overdose or alter your senses and mentation.  I personally know that this supplement is safe in my life.  I undergo my yearly health check ups with lab work and have undergone a routine colonoscopy to make sure that this product is safe.  Kratom has been a miracle for me and my daily life.  I believe that if people had been given the opportunity to use Kratom supplement instead of opiates, they would chose Kratom.  No one starts out wanting to be an opiate addict.  These people are only seeking pain relief so, they can function "normally."  I have witnessed many good people become unintentional opiate addicts over a 15 year span.   I am pleading with you to support the Kratom community and call for more research on this botanical species to how it actually works.  I believe Kratom is an answer to the treatment of neurological and bone type chronic pain people suffer from.  My own personal use and research of this product is that it is an effective treatment for bone and neurological chronic pain syndromes.  Kratom does not give you a "feel good" sensation, it simply decreases or stops the chronic pain I suffer from.  I am urging you to please learn more about this botanical that our lord God has placed on earth and is not a man made substance that is harmful to mankind.  Kratom is a gift placed here for our benefit.  It is our duty to study and research this botanical and let people know how God has provided a natural substance to relieve the everyday pain people experience due to the wear tear of hard work that has stressed and damaged our bodies.  I am urging the DEA to stand with me and the Kratom community and do not ban or schedule this botanical .
Sincerely, 
Teresa Fitts, Family Nurse Practitioner-Board Certified

documents.commentText:
In reference to docket number DEA-442W

 I am a 30yr old wife, mother, and full time direct care staff for an agency supporting individuals with developmental disabilities. Since puberty I've suffered with severe anxiety, depression, ADHD, and more. By age 19 I had already been diagnosed with multiple stomach ulcers caused by constant stress and had back problems from my time working as a CNA in a nursing home. I've been on every antidepressant, anxiety med, and sleeping pill under the sun to no avail. I might feel better for awhile but my anxiety and depression always drug me back down. Trying to stop those medications had life threatening effects that I wasn't even aware of until i was dealing with them first hand. For years I drank alcohol to cope with my issues which only caused more problems. Since I was introduced to Kratom about 6 months ago I have no desire to drink and am far less reliant on medications like Adderall, Effexor, Valium, Ambien, Flexeril. Supplementing with Kratom daily has allowed me to cut back or even stop taking some of these medications entirely due to the plants positive effects. My mood, pain, and energy levels are more balanced and because of that my anxiety and depression have eased significantly. Instead of drinking my pain away I can now enjoy every moment with my 19 month old son, thus making me a better mother.
I am against any scheduling of Kratom being used in it's raw, natural form. Kratom doesn't get me high or impair my judgement. Instead, I feel more alert and focused than I ever felt on antidepressants and bezodiazapines. Kratom is not a synthetic drug however, if it's banned I'm certain a dangerous synthetic attempting to mimic it's alkaloids will not be far behind. This plant is far too complex to even be given a lower schedule at this point in time without additional research because every individual is different and a doctor would not know how to adequately prescribe strains and dosages for the wide array of benefits Kratom can offer. Kratom is not a cure for anything but it is certainly an herbal supplement that should be available for myself and other consumers. If the goal here is to protect the public, do more research and require vendors to test their product for purity to avoid any harmful synthetics being added. Prohibition is not the answer. We as people of a free nation should be able to choose what to do with a safe, all natural plant. Thank you for your consideration. Please do not schedule Kratom.

documents.commentText:
To whom it may concern,
I'm a 26 year old woman, who is disabled from a chronic illness. I was diagnosed with my illness when I was 18 years old, and my quality of life had greatly depleted. I underwent weekly IV therapy and numerous medications, and I was not getting much better. Slight improvement, but not enough. I eventually found out about Kratom when researching about natural remedies to treat my fatigue and chronic pain, and after 3 months of research and reading testimonies from people of all backgrounds, I decided to give it a try. Since then, I have no fainted, I have more energy, and my chronic pain has decreased. Now, that's not to say I have been "cured" because I still have bad days. But, my "bad days" are a little less bad. My good days, are even better. I'm now a mom of two, I work from home, and my quality of life is so great. 
While I cannot tell you the exact science of how Kratom works, but I do know you can access that information from The American Kratom Association. I worry about what life will be like, without Kratom. Not because I'm "dependent" on it, not in an addict sort of way. I do not "crave" it, like you would a prescription drug. I take it as needed, and I may take it a few times in a day, or I may go a week without it. I worry about what life will be like again, without Kratom. With mountains of pill bottles and trips to Urgent Care for IV therapy. 
I plead with you,  to take our stories into account upon your upcoming decision. For Kratom has done far more good in this world, than bad. Please recognize the deaths "from Kratom" were deaths that were combined with prescription drugs. Kratom, alone, has never killed anyone. 
I don't know if I will truly be heard, but it has to be impossible to not hear so many crying out against this potential ban. Many lives are in your hands, please do not believe a ban is more helpful, than harmful.

documents.commentText:
I do not agree with a proposed ban on Kratom (Mitragyna speciosa.)

Kratom is a natural, whole food supplement that has been effective in providing me with relief from pinched nerve and back pain related issues (carpal tunnel syndrome and sciatica), allowing me to remain productive at my office desk throughout the work day.

I have never noticed any adverse effects after consuming a cup of Kratom tea.

The proposed rescheduling of a known, whole food herb like Kratom to become a Schedule I narcotic is absolutely ludicrous.

Schedule I classification has a real-world definition and meaning.  There is little to no evidence that Kratom even remotely qualifies as a Schedule I narcotic.  The major body of scientific evidence would corroborate that neither stipulation for Schedule I classification applies to Kratom.

I am 57 years old.  I owned a business for 29 years; I just started a new business to serve the elderly and disabled.   I am a husband, father of four children, and am an ordained minister.   I can still work because Kratom is helping me live a normal life!  Despite having suffered from severe back pain due to bulging disks (and surgery) as the result of a car accident, spinal stenosis, Fibromyalgia and Sjogrens Syndrome, Kratom has helped with each of those ailments so that I can function normally. Before using Kratom, the only relief medicine could supply for me was Oxycodone, and surgery, neither of which solved my problems.  A pain management doctor suggested that we try a spinal cord stimulator to see if it will help.  We had come to the point of just guessing at what might work.

I do not need to guess at what might work; I know what works, Kratom.  The most relief I have had is from Kratom. I do not wish to lose that ability over misconceptions and incorrect information.

Since using kratom, I no longer need Oxycodone for pain.  Sjogren's and fibromyalgia are much more manageable. While I do still take Plaquenil and Lyrica for Sjogren's and fibromyalgia respectively, I can function with no other prescription medication except Lisinopril (for high blood pressure).

Kratom does not get me high and never has.  I am not looking for a high.  People I have come to know who use kratom do not want to get high either.  I have never heard anyone say he or she have gotten high from Kratom.  There are no reports that I have found where Kratom alone has led to death.  Can any prescription medication for pain make that claim?
Lets not demonize a safe alternative to narcotics that helps countless people every day.  Kratom is a legitimate product that is doing a tremendous amount of good for many people.  Please do not ban Kratom.

If Kratom is banned, I will have no option but to go back to pain management doctors, prescription medications including narcotics, and trying to guess at what is going to work for me.  I have long felt that without Kratom I would be unemployed.  I would not be able to put the work into my business that I do now unless I started taking more and more pain medication.  That was the trend that I saw when I was on pain medication.  I constantly had to increase the dosage to manage pain.  I have not experienced that with Kratom.  I am still taking the same dosage at the same intervals that I found worked for me three years ago.

This comment in reference to Docket No. DEA-442W in your comment and submit.  Thank you.

documents.commentText:
Hi,

I am a devoted user of Mitragyna Speciosa. I, in all honesty, can not believe this could be schedulded as a controlled substance. For one, I use it for my sleep disorder. I was diagnosed with insomnia years ago, I had been prescribed Ambien, it had no use for me. Mitragyna Speciosa helps me wind down when I pillow my head. Nothing else has been as effective. I also use it in the mornings after a night of no sleep, although; it does not help me sleep every night. But I believe it also has a similar effect as coffee, but with a slightly mild boost. I see no reason to abuse this herb, I also use it for my social anxiety. I've recommended it to friends and family who have similar complications. I and everyone in my life do not abuse it. There's no reason or desire to abuse it. I do understand it's been an eye catcher by the younger generation by head shops and other sources. I will testify that this plant does not get you "high." I am 23 years old, I'm around alcohol and other substances from time to time. I can legally purchase alcohol, so if I wanted to "party" and get "high," by all means, nothing would stop me. But I don't, I choose this plant because I can still function as I can when I'm sober. I see no potential for this to be abused as a recreational substance. I also do not view it as an herb to treat any illness. The effects are mildly noticed, and it is nowhere near a prescribed substance and should never be categorized as such. Research shows that it is in the same family/category as coffee, and it is used for nothing more by myself. As I've stated, personally, I see no use for abusing it recreationally. I have yet to notice any side effects from use. It does not keep me up at night, and I have no complications with consistant use. I see no reason to place Mitragyna Speciosa as a Schedule I substance! Thank you for your time!

Sincerely,
A Concerned User

Kratom has helped alleviate my anxiety tremendously. I suffer from generalized anxiety, social anxiety, and mild depression. Coming from a family of drug addicts, I chose at a young age that was NOT the life for me; thus, I've refused prescription medication for my anxiety.

Today, I am 4 years anxiety/panic attack-free. If you've ever suffered from an anxiety attack, you understand how truly detrimental they are for the lives of the sufferers if experienced often (which used to be the case for me). I attribute my current mental well-being to a few things; eating and organic vegan diet, meditation, and the wonderful plant I came across 3 years ago: kratom. 

 On days when I feel particularly stressed, I use kratom. On days I am feeling uncomfortable in my own skin and reclusive, I use kratom. On days when I just can't seem to focus and dig myself out of the dark trench of depression, I use kratom. For me, kratom is a beautiful plant that tremendously increases my quality of life.

Please, for the people of this nation, I ask you to step outside of box that may have been built up in your mind concerning this plant. Let us see what this plant has to offer, before condemning it.

documents.commentText:
When I heard about the potential Kratom ban I was truly shocked. The DEA was going to ban a health supplement that's in the coffee family and has helped so many people for a variety of reasons? It truly threw me for a loop. The DRUG enforcement agency was going to ban something that many people use for mild pain management (myself included) and force us to have to use highly addictive narcotic drugs while there is an opiod epidemic in this country? It's been studied before and found the leaves weren't addictive like heroin or Vicodin.  was baffled, it contradicts itself.

My story with kratom started five years ago after I had my second baby. During the pregnancy and afterwards (to this very day) I had terrible migraines, so bad that I couldn't function through my daily life. After the pregnancy, I tried numerous migraine medications, blood pressure pills, tension headache medications, etc., and nothing seemed to work. I saw a neurologist and had MRIs done and the bottom line was that I just had chronic migraines. I started taking Vicoprofen to help with the pain, and while it did help, it made me nauseated and tired and unlike myself. I couldn't take my kids anywhere if I took it and I couldn't play with them if I didn't because I was in so much pain. I started researching alternative methods to migraine control and came across kratom. I researched and researched and researched and finally decided to try it because anything had to be better than what I was doing. The bottom line is, kratom helped with my migraines immensely and though it doesn't work as well as a narcotic, I could function and I wasn't tired and compared to a full blown migraine, I could absolutely deal with minor twinges here and there. 

I know of many people who use kratom for almost anything you can think of-back aches (like my husband), insomnia, depression, tooth aches, RLS, an alternate to coffee in the morning, and one of the biggest ones to me is that this plant helps people get off heroin and other opioids. I know of health detox places that have helped so many addicts withdraw off these strong, addictive drugs. I know even know of elderly people who drink kratom tea.  I myself have taken kratom for around five years, as needed, and I react to it the same way I do when I drink coffee, to me they are almost the same thing. Kratom users don't overdose, they don't get in car accidents because of it, they don't steal or commit crime because of kratom, they don't chose kratom over their children and families, they don't lose their jobs because of kratom, etc. To compare kratom to drugs like meth and heroin, drugs that absolutely destroy people's lives and everyone around them, is just wrong on so many levels.

I guess all I can say to conclude is to ask you to let this one be. I know you have an important job to do and I completely respect you for that, but you're way off base with this one. I'm asking you as a mother, a wife, a daughter, and a productive member of society to please understand the health benefits to this supplement. I do not want to take narcotics pills again (ever if I can help it) and I won't have a choice if kratom is available. Those drugs kill people and thinking about having to be on them for a long period of time really scares me. 

Thanks for reading, I hope to send you a thank you here in the immediate future.

documents.commentText:
I am a 60 year old, college-educated male with no criminal history, and no history of drug abuse. I have had Crohn's disease since my early adult life. Eventually I had to stop working in a lucrative and rewarding career in order to manage this disease, and mitigate the effects of stress on it. I have been on a variety of medicines for this disease including the most recent and very expensive biologics. Most are very expensive, have dangerous / damaging side effects and none have given me significant, lasting relief. 

On my own, I have tried, in parallel with conventional medicines for Crohn's disease, almost every herbal medicine and alternative therapy out there. I ran across Kratom a number of years ago and am a regular user as it is the ONLY substance that provides substantial and consistent relief from the symptoms of this horrible disease. My doctors are aware of my use of this natural remedy, and have not discouraged me from using it.  I have experienced absolutely no side-effects from my daily use of Kratom. It is also inexpensive when compared to ANY prescription drug I've been on. One doctor has even expressed an interest in recommending it to other patients of his who suffer from IBD given my remarkable outcome.

There are little or no intoxicating effects from this medicine...if anything, it is a mild stimulant akin to coffee. It you doubt this, buy some and try it!!! With marijuana becoming legal in many states (including my ow home state of Florida), which DOES have intoxicating effects, I can't fathom what the DEA's motivation is for taking away this mild and innocuous medicine that provides safe and effective relief to so many, with no evidence to the contrary. My intent is to continue to use this natural and safe herbal remedy no matter what, because the consequence of not doing so are nearly intolerable.

documents.commentText:
This proposed ban is not about saving people. In fact, it is about DESTROYING lives to protect the lifestyles of the corporate elite. It is yet another example of crony capitalism buying a government that criminalizes those who dare to seek treatment outside of industrially-sponsored medicine.

People have used kratom for pain relief and opioid withdrawl with more success and/or fewer side effects than mainstram pharmaceuticals for centuries. People using prescribed medications as directed have had more and more severe side effects than those who have sought out natural (i.e. unpatentable, non-synthetic, non-laboratory) remedies.

What this ban IS about is saving the profits of companies that isolate "active compounds" from the natural substance (which often contains "waste" compounds that mitigate adverse effects), artificially re-create them (so they can be patented), and put on the market after biased studies that exaggerate the effectiveness of the resulting drug and minimize the evidence of harmful effects via selective choice of "placebo," not carrying studies long enough to determine cumulative effects, and cherry-picking statistics, among other deceptive tactics.

The very nomenclature ("Mitragynine and 7-Hydroxymitragynine" vs. "kratom") proves that the DEA has wholeheartedly adopted the "Big Pharma" view of "active component is the only component that matters" and does not appreciate nor care about the difference between natural remedies and industrialrially-synthesized chemistry.

documents.commentText:
See attached file for my full comment.
I commend the Drug Enforcement Agency's decision to accept a short period of professional and public comment regarding the legality of Kratom. This herbal supplement has greatly improved the lives of millions across the country and implementing a ban on Kratom will worsen the existing opioid epidemic. An estimated 69% of users stated that they will seek opioid medication as an alternative if Kratom becomes illegal [1]. 29 million people cannot afford health insurance and a single hospital visit can cost tens of thousands of dollars or more [2]. Acute and chronic illnesses have destroyed the finances of so many citizens. Although I do not believe that Kratom should be a substitute for medical care, people can use Kratom to manage diagnosed chronic symptoms that otherwise forces them into ongoing expensive doctor visits.
I am a 32 year-old male and have been a daily consumer of Kratom for 5 years. I am deeply grateful for those pain-free years. My experience with Kratom has been nothing short of life-changing. I have a history of a herniated disc in my lower back as well as left-sided kidney problems including multiple surgeries and kidney stones. I spent two years being prescribed Hydrocodone and Oxycodone by my physician. I consumed these medications on a daily basis and every 3-6 months my physician decided to increase my dosage. My primary reason for the pursuit of a natural alternative to opioids was because these drugs caused me to feel trapped, dependent, depressed, and hopeless. I also learned that these medications are derived from the same source as heroin and can be equally addictive and potentially deadly. My doctor failed to explain the history and risks associated with prescription opioids. Even if I was informed, there is no better alternative in prescription pain management except for Kratom.
Kratom provides me with a significantly reduced level of pain, which allows me to live a normal happy life. My health insurance provider and I are not forced to spend significant sums of money to see a physician on a monthly basis for the purpose of receiving pain medications. To further hinder patients experiencing chronic pain, the CDC has released new opioid prescribing guidelines in March, 2016 which recommends physicians to scale back on prescribing pain medications [3]. With regard to people in chronic pain, physicians provide very few effective alternatives to opioid medication. I have tried chiropractic care, over-the-counter pain medication, topical creams, back support devices, stretches, and exercises and none of these methods came close to the relief provided by Kratom. My use of Kratom has not altered my daily life in any way. I have worked full-time, I help support my wife and daughter, and I currently maintain a 3.15 GPA in college with the help of Kratom. This natural remedy has never hindered my ability to function normally. In fact, Kratom has allowed me to have a better quality of life by suppressing my chronic pain. Although Kratom elevates my mood, I have never felt a "high" through the use of this herbal supplement. Claims have alleged that Kratom is both habit-forming and increases tolerance over time. If I stop taking Kratom, I experience mild symptoms very similar to quitting a caffeine regiment. For the past 5 years I have taken the exact same dose with no need to increase.
I discovered that people around the world benefit from Kratom. I also found that Kratom is grown, harvested, processed, and sold in a 100% natural state. There are no chemical alterations or synthesized processes in the production of Kratom, unlike prescribed and illicit opioids. Kratom is not a member of the opioid family but instead falls directly into the coffee family. It is known that Kratom binds to opioid receptors in the brain, but this is not been extensively studied. A natural substance is not classified as an opioid just because it contains elements that bind to opioid receptors. For example, here are some items used in our daily lives that contain opioid compounds: dark chocolate contains an antioxidant, epicatechin, that binds to the -opioid receptors; the oil cafestrol in coffee is known to produce morphine-like activity, spinach contains the opioid peptides rubiscolins-5 and rubiscolins-6; an opioid peptide known as gluten exorphin is found in wheat; and an opioid peptide called casomorphin is found in cow's milk. Just because Kratom contains a compound that is known to bind with certain opioid receptors doesn't automatically require it to be labeled as a dangerous opioid substance. Otherwise chocolate, coffee, spinach, wheat, and milk must also be labeled as opioids. [4]
The Drug Enforcement Agency reports that Kratom is "an imminent threat to public safety", but a ban on Kratom will only further support this claim. The continued legalization of Kratom will only prove the opposite. --- (Comment continues in the attached file)
